title: LysKOM
text:
LysKOM is a <a href="KOM%20%28BBS%29">KOM</a>-based conferencing system developed by the <a href="Lysator">Lysator Academic Computer Society</a> at <a href="Link%C3%B6ping%20University">Linköping University</a> and <a href="Link%C3%B6ping%20Institute%20of%20Technology">Linköping Institute of Technology</a>. It can be seen as a cross between <a href="Network%20News%20Transfer%20Protocol">news</a> and <a href="e-mail">e-mail</a>, but with the presence and speed of <a href="IRC">IRC</a> or <a href="Instant%20messaging">IM-networks</a>. The most common client is the LysKOM <a href="Emacs%20Lisp">Emacs Lisp Client</a>, but among others a <a href="WWW">WWW</a>-based client also exists. The server and most clients are released under the terms of the <a href="GNU%20General%20Public%20License">GNU General Public License</a>, and thus <a href="free%20software">free software</a>. The LysKOM protocol uses <a href="TCP%20and%20UDP%20port%20numbers">port 4894</a>.
Protocol implementations exist for <a href="Python%20%28programming%20language%29">Python</a>, <a href="Perl">Perl</a> and <a href="Pike%20%28programming%20language%29">Pike</a>. Based on these frameworks, a number of programs for bridging LysKOM with other systems have been written. Notable among these is the Python software for importing and exporting e-mail. Used as a whole, it enables the LysKOM system to act as a primitive <a href="Mailing%20list">list manager</a>. By configuring the exporter to not reexport imported e-mail it is also possible to use LysKOM more like a multi-user <a href="e-mail%20client">e-mail client</a> for posting to mailing lists.
LysKOM also refers to the specific installation hosted by Lysator at kom.lysator.liu.se.
